data.title: Don Johnson interview: the Miami Vice star on sex in your sixties, the women in his life and his new film, Book Club
data.meta_description: I am sitting at the corner banquette of a restaurant in Studio City, Los Angeles, waiting for Don Johnson. It’s a pleasant, discreet Italian restaurant and I am at the quiet table that I requested. It was waiting for me along with a basket of rosemary and garlic flatbread and sweet-tomato chopped sa
data.text:
I am sitting at the corner banquette of a restaurant in Studio City, Los Angeles, waiting for Don Johnson. It’s a pleasant, discreet Italian restaurant and I am at the quiet table that I requested. It was waiting for me along with a basket of rosemary and garlic flatbread and sweet-tomato chopped salad on the house. I’ve been here about 15 minutes when his publicist calls me. “Where are you? He’s waiting for you. He’s in the restaurant in a corner table.”

I look up, walk round the slightly rustic bar and find him … at another corner table. I beckon him to join me. I’m slightly animated, nervy, foolish, but he summons me. I must join him. He has the same flatbread, but untouched.
